Crimes.Legal_Issue: Inadmissibility under paragraph 36(1)(c) of the IRPA due to use of fraudulent documents
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Admissibility hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Fraudulent passport and driver's license used in the UK
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Use of fraudulent documents outside Canada
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Serious criminality punishable by at least 10 years imprisonment
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Use of fraudulent driver's license unrelated to entry into Canada
Crimes.Application_Factor: Geographic and contextual relevance of document use
Crimes.Authority: Immigration Division, Federal Court on judicial review
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Use of fraudulent driver's license in the UK
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Distinction between passport and driver’s license use
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Amendment of subsection 44(1) report deemed fair
Crimes.Relevant_Law: IRPA, Canadian criminal law on forgery
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Serious criminality based on uttering forged document

Crimes.Crime_Name: Fraudulent acquisition of a driver's licence
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Inadmissibility under paragraph 36(1)(c) of the IRPA due to fraudulent acquisition of a driver's licence
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Admissibility hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Fraudulent driver's license obtained in the UK
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Acquisition and use of fraudulent identification abroad
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Serious criminality punishable by at least 10 years imprisonment
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Act not related to entering Canada; section 133 does not apply
Crimes.Application_Factor: Purpose and context of document use
Crimes.Authority: Immigration Division, Federal Court on judicial review
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Fraudulent acquisition of driver's license in the UK
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Distinction between entry-related and non-entry-related document use
Crimes.Relevant_Law: IRPA, Canadian criminal law on fraud and forgery
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Serious criminality based on fraudulent acquisition of official document

Crimes.Legal_Issue: Inadmissibility under paragraph 36(1)(c) of the IRPA for uttering a forged document
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Admissibility hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Use of forged passport and driver's license in the UK
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Punishable by at least 10 years imprisonment under Canadian law
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Use of forged driver's license not protected under section 133
Crimes.Application_Factor: Nature and purpose of document use
Crimes.Authority: Immigration Division, Federal Court on judicial review
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Uttering forged driver's license in the UK
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Differentiation between passport and driver’s license use
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Amendment of subsection 44(1) report considered fair
Crimes.Relevant_Law: IRPA, Canadian criminal law on forgery (s. 368 of Criminal Code)
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Serious criminality based on uttering forged document
